common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connection Issues with JetBrains and VS Code
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting Pieces OS to JetBrains plugins and VS Code, particularly in remote environments like Docker. This is often caused by network configuration issues, such as Pieces OS listening only on the loopback interface. Solutions include upgrading to the latest Pieces OS and plugin versions, configuring custom URLs, and modifying DNS settings. The Pieces team actively provides support and workarounds, including patches and potential live debugging sessions.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS does not connect to Jetbrains plugin
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS does not connect to Jetbrains plugin
### Software

Pieces OS, JetBrains

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.9

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Jetbrains plugin not connecting to pieces OS even though it is online 
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2a336b09-c8ed-4d3a-88c3-f9f582f95f4d)

## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* @Farhan-Nahiyan reported an issue with Pieces OS on 2024-10-11.
* @caleb-at-pieces requested logs and offered to debug the issue live on a call.

**Problems Identified:**

* An unspecified issue prevents the proper functioning of Pieces OS.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @caleb-at-pieces proposed the following solutions:
    * Analyze logs from Documents\com.pieces.os\production\Support\logs
    * Live debugging session (schedule available here: https://calendar.app.google/vg5ZoiWHqHrGQy5j7)
    * Installation of a custom development build (https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Qp1zjSatS6wg7EjT8NzVWHAyG4poaq22/view?usp=sharing) 

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* It's unclear if @Farhan-Nahiyan provided the logs or participated in a call with @caleb-at-pieces.
* The user was instructed to install a specific development build for testing and then uninstall it before returning to the production version.
* No subsequent comments are provided, leaving the final resolution ambiguous.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key Points Raised:** * User (@malanciault) is unable to connect to Pieces OS from VSCode DevContainer. * The issue occurs even without a VS Code project open. * Removing the custom URL and opening non-remote projects works. * Opening a remote project inside Docker causes the issue. **Problems Identified:** * Networking changes in Pieces OS 11.0.0 caused the server to listen only on the loopback interface by default. * The DevContainer's `host.docker.internal` resolution conflicts with the Copilot webview tool windows. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Patch to allow listening on all interfaces. * Ability to change the listening interface in settings (not yet implemented). * Workaround involving DNS name entry and `/etc/hosts` modification. * VSCode extension version 2.0.1 with automatic Pieces OS detection. **Current Status/Outcome:** * Patch implemented in VSCode extension version 2.0.2, resolving the issue. **Additional Notes:** * User and developer discussed a potential video call to further diagnose the issue before the patch was implemented.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connection Issues in Remote Environments
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting Pieces OS to IDE extensions (VSCode, JetBrains) in remote environments like WSL2 and Docker.  This is often due to networking configurations and Pieces OS listening on specific interfaces. Solutions include custom URL configurations, Pieces OS patches to broaden listening interfaces, and ensuring proper DNS resolution within the remote environment.

related_issues.title: VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
related_issues.text:
VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When Pieces OS is installed via snap in WSL2 for windows and VSCode is also installed through snap in WSL2, there is an issue detecting Pieces OS location and setting the proper API url.


Setting a custom url to the linux port 'http://localhost:5323' and following the WSL steps listed here: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance allows for communication between the VSCode extension and Pieces OS itself.

However, when VSCode attempts to request the Pieces Copilot -- The applet is launched on a port, the port is returned to the extension, but the Copilot fails to render in VSCode.

Until the root cause is detected and resolved, the recommended workaround is to install Pieces OS via Pieces Suite and run VSCode outside of WSL2 if at all possible.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* The root cause of the problem might be within WSL2, as network issues have been reported in similar scenarios.
* Systemd is enabled in the user's /etc/wsl.conf file, and the networking mode is set to mirrored.
* The Pieces VSCode extension can connect to Pieces OS, but the Copilot is not rendered properly.
* The issue might be related to snap installation instead of WSL2.

**Proposed Solutions:**

* Use the dns-tunnel option in WSL2.
* Check if the Systemd option helps.

**Current Status:**

* The user will investigate further and update the ticket with additional information.

**Outcome:**

* The issue is currently unresolved.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Bugs and Issues
common_issues.description: Users are reporting various bugs in the Pieces Desktop App, including issues with saving conversation titles, persistent welcome messages, and non-dismissable overlay messages. The Pieces team is actively investigating these issues, providing workarounds, and planning patches for future releases.

related_issues.title: Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
related_issues.text:
Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I click on the title of Conversation in the Desktop app, I can edit it as expected but it will update save the input before I'm done editing.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Point:** User @seantiz reported an issue with the Pieces app.

**Problem Identified:** The user experienced "odd behavior" when using the app. No specific details about the issue were provided.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** 
* @mack-at-pieces acknowledged the issue and stated that the team would investigate and release a patch soon.
* No specific solutions were proposed or implemented within this conversation.

**Current Status/Outcome:** The issue is acknowledged and under investigation. An update with a patch is expected soon.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue Title:** Unable to connect to Pieces Cloud Service from Windows Desktop App

**Key Points:**

* User "ThemePark" reported being unable to connect to the Pieces Cloud Service from the Windows Desktop App.
* The issue was automatically triaged by the `pieces-support-bot`.
* The bot suggested similar issues and relevant resources.
* @mack-at-pieces, a Pieces team member, requested additional information about the user's system and software versions.

**Problems Identified:**

* User cannot connect to the Pieces Cloud Service from the Windows Desktop App. 

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* None yet, but further troubleshooting is planned based on the requested information.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Open, pending further information from the user.

common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Service Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Copilot not working, getting stuck loading, or receiving error messages. This appears across operating systems and Pieces versions. Proposed solutions include waiting for the next Pieces update, removing OpenAI keys, or switching to a different model like GPT4o.

related_issues.title: Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
related_issues.text:
Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## GitHub Issue Summary: API Key Issues

### Key Points Raised:

* Users were experiencing issues with the product.
* Removing the OpenAI API key resolved the issue for some users.

### Problems Identified:

* OpenAI API keys were becoming invalid.
* Issues with the Claude and Gemini services caused problems for some users.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

* Users were advised to remove their OpenAI API keys.
* Switching to the GPT4o model was suggested as a temporary workaround.
* Updating to 11.0.3 and being signed in to Pieces was recommended.
* Switching to an OpenAI model was proposed as an alternative.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* The issue seems to be resolved for users who removed their OpenAI API keys.
* The root cause of the problem with OpenAI API keys is still being investigated.
* The team is actively looking into the issues with the Claude and Gemini services.

### Additional Information:

* It is unclear if the OpenAI API key issues are related to the problems with the Claude and Gemini services.
* The team is working to resolve all of these issues.

**Key points raised**:

* Gittydia reported an issue where Claude 3.5 Copilot was not responding correctly with the error message "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with the processing..."
* User is experiencing this issue while using the Pieces app.

**Problems identified**:

* Claude 3.5 Copilot responses are not functioning correctly.
* This issue is impacting Gittydia's ability to use Pieces effectively.

**Solutions proposed/implemented**:

* Pieces support identified a potential fix for the issue.
* This fix will be included in the upcoming PiecesOS release 11.0.4, scheduled for release no later than Thursday.

**Current status/outcome**:

* The issue has not yet been resolved, but the fix is expected to be available in the next PiecesOS release.
* Gittydia is asked to report back on Friday if the issue persists after the update.

**Additional notes**:

* The conversation includes links to related issues and helpful resources.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Search and Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS search functionality returning no results or being stuck connecting. Issues also include latency, scrolling problems, and incorrect line numbers in code view. Proposed solutions involve upgrading search functionality and addressing context issues in code processing.

related_issues.title: Neural Code Search returns no results
related_issues.text:
Neural Code Search returns no results
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have four materials entered since a few days ago and NCS type search never returns anything.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cea82b95-b382-45f3-8777-227d3abd2269)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/175e6117-9ef6-49c0-94f2-26812b788080)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation about Pieces Search

**Key Points:**

* User (@hovek) reported an issue with the search functionality in Pieces.
* Support bot (@pieces-support-bot) acknowledged the issue and provided resources.
* Pieces team member (@mark-at-pieces) responded and explained the different search methods available:
    * NCS: semantic search for code meaning
    * FTS: character-based search for code content
    * Blended: search code content + metadata and fuzzy matching
* The team acknowledged the need for search improvements and mentioned an upcoming upgrade planned for the end of the quarter.

**Problems Identified:**

* User found the current search confusing and not meeting expectations.
* Support tickets have been raised about search functionality in the past.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces team is planning a major upgrade to the search functionality.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been acknowledged and prioritized for improvement.
* Specific details and timeline for the upgrade are not yet available.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* @bschwenk reported two issues:
    * Context issues using the file specifically with Gemini 1.5 flash and GPT4o.
    * Line numbers wrapping.
* @mark-at-pieces confirmed the issues and noted that they might result from the context not including the file.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* @sam-at-pieces proposed and implemented a fix for the context issue, ensuring the file is included in the context.
* The fix will be released in the upcoming version 11.0.4.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The context issue is resolved and will be released soon.
* The line number wrapping issue is still being investigated by @mack-at-pieces.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation also mentions related issues and helpful resources.
* @bschwenk expressed gratitude towards the Pieces team and the quick resolution.

recommendations: **Prioritize Connection Issues:** Focus on resolving connection issues between Pieces OS and IDE extensions (VSCode, JetBrains) in both local and remote environments. This is a recurring and high-impact problem affecting user experience.

**Improve Desktop App Stability:** Address bugs and issues reported for the Pieces Desktop App, such as saving conversation titles, persistent welcome messages, and non-dismissable overlays. These impact usability and user confidence.

**Enhance Copilot Service Reliability:** Investigate and resolve issues related to Pieces Copilot, including loading problems, error messages, and inconsistencies across operating systems. A reliable Copilot experience is crucial for user satisfaction.
**Optimize Search Functionality:** Address the issues with Pieces OS search, such as no results, inaccurate line numbers, and latency. Improve search accuracy and speed to enhance productivity.

**Proactive Communication:** Keep users informed about known issues, planned patches, and workarounds through release notes, blog posts, and in-app notifications. Transparency builds trust and reduces support requests.

**Invest in Troubleshooting Documentation:** Create detailed troubleshooting guides for common issues, particularly connection problems in remote environments. This empowers users to resolve issues independently.
**Gather Detailed Diagnostics:** When users encounter issues, collect comprehensive logs, system information, and steps to reproduce the problem. This helps developers diagnose and fix issues faster.

**Prioritize Issues Based on Impact and Frequency:** Use data on ticket frequency, activity level, and user impact to prioritize development efforts. Focus on resolving the most critical issues first.

**Consider User Feedback:** Analyze user feedback from support tickets, community forums, and surveys to identify pain points and areas for improvement. User input is invaluable for product development.
